en.title: Decision-aid methodologies in transportation
en.library_recommends: • "Discrete choice analysis : theory and application to travel demand / Moshe E. Ben-Akiva, Steven R.Lerman". Year:1997. ISBN:0-262-02217-6

free_text.Bibliographie et matériel: Ben-Akiva & Lerman (1985) Discrete Choice Analysis, MIT Press.
free_text.Contenu: The course will be divided into modules associated to concrete case studies. Each module will contain four parts:[br/][br/]1.	Presentation of the problem, outline of the process, analysis of major difficulties[br/]2.	Introduction to methodological and software tools[br/]3.	Solution of a concrete problem by the lecturer, using real data.[br/]4.	Solution of similar problems by the students, using also real data.[br/][br/][br/]The list of modules will evolve depending on data availability, and recent projects performed in our laboratory. At this point, the proposed modules are. [br/][br/][b]Demand forecasting[/b][br/]1. Transportation demand: discrete choice models[br/]2. Modal split forecasting, price optimization, value of time.[br/]3. Software package: BIOGEME (biogeme.epfl.ch)[br/]4. Case study : modal splits.[br/][br/][b]Planning of air transportation[/b][br/]1. Problems of airlines[br/]2. Scheduling of flights, aircrafts and crews[br/]3. Tool: Schedule Planner, APM Technologies[br/]4. Case study : Thomas Cook
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Practical approach of complex transportation problems using modeling tools.
